column4: Can i send a password with telnet? Ex: telnet server.com 22 password="test" ?
no, telnet has no specific support for passwords
(besides, keep in mind that passwrods via telnet is not quite a good idea anyway)
So i have to type it in? Yes i know this, its clear text and easy sniff. But i need to send everything without user input
you could pipe something into telnet. like  echo mypassword | telnet blah.com  22  - i suppose it should work. or use "chat" if you need something more complicated (like, waiting for a login prompt)
